How to Install iitalian on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • iitalian

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install iitalian on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing iitalian on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall iitalian in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install iitalian, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install iitalian Using apt

To install iitalian in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install iitalian using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install iitalian

The installation of iitalian might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install iitalian Using apt-get

To install iitalian using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install iitalian.

sudo apt-get -y install iitalian

Install iitalian Using Synaptic

To install iitalian using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install iitalian on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for iitalian. This will display the iitalian package in the package window, now to install iitalian, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the iitalian package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of iitalian.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install iitalian Using aptitude

To install iitalian on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of iitalian.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install iitalian using the command aptitude install iitalian.

sudo aptitude -y install iitalian

How to Upgrade iitalian on debian

If you want to upgrade the iitalian package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade iitalian using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade iitalian to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade iitalian.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade iitalian sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade iitalian

Upgrade iitalian using Aptitude

To upgrade iitalian using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade iitalian.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade iitalian

Upgrade iitalian using Synaptic

To upgrade iitalian using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for iitalian, now right-click iitalian, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade iitalian just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall iitalian on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall iitalian from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just iitalian, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove iitalian

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of iitalian

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of iitalian you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge iitalian

Remove iitalian using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall iitalian using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for iitalian, right-click the iitalian package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall iitalian click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install iitalian on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade iitalian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of iitalian then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
